string-array.item: Lemon juice added to a mug of water can be used as a conditioner for very oily hair.
Use conditioner regularly if you have colored your hair as chemical dyes make hair dry and frizzy.
To minimize hair loss during brushing use a hair brush with ball-tipped bristles and avoid combing wet hair.
Washing hair with very hot water can make it look dull because it strips off the natural oil film that gives shine to hair.
Very tightly pulled hairstyles tug at the root of your hair and weaken it. Keep the style relaxed to avoid hair damage.
One round of thorough shampooing is enough to clean your hair. Repeating the process is a waste of time, effort and of course shampoo.
To get rid of split ends, get a trim at least every six weeks.
Use shampoo with ingredients that include sunscreen and moisturizing cream if your hair is extremely dry.
Color treated hair is more prone to damage caused by extended sun exposure. Use a hat to protect your hair.
Thoroughly wet your hair before plunging into the swimming pool to protect it from damage caused by chlorinated pool water.
Avoid plucking hair to remove gray hair. It won`t cause more gray hair, but can damage your hair root.
After applying hair conditioner rinse your hair with cold water as hot water will strip off the conditioning agent.
If you frequently use a blow-dryer, use a conditioner regularly as it can decrease hair damage caused by blow-drying.
For lustrous hair, massage your scalp with warm coconut oil, wrap your hair with a hot towel for about fifteen minutes and then shampoo.
Make sure that your diet has adequate amount of protein if you are fighting hair fall.
Head massage once a month with a mix of coconut, castor, olive and almond oil is great to nourish dry hair.
When coloring gray hair opt for a color close to your own hair color for a natural look and minimum appearance of roots.
Regular use of a protein rich conditioner can repair split ends and hair damage caused by excessive styling.
Regular gentle head massage promotes blood flow to hair follicles and can help reduce hair fall.
Homemade conditioner for dry hair: mix half cup yogurt with one egg white and apply for thirty minutes.
Lemon juice added to a mug of water can be used as a conditioner for very oily hair.
Rinse your mouth after having citrus fruits and lemon as citric acid in these fruits can erode tooth enamel.
Put frozen tea bags on closed eyes for 20 minutes three times a week to reduce dark circles and puffiness.
Groomed eyebrows are a must for a neat and smart look. But avoid pencil thin or high arches as they look unnatural.
Even when you are not wearing any eye make up, curl your eyelashes to make your eyes look larger and brighter.
If you have dark circles, apply an under eye gel containing a lightening ingredient like vitamin C and a collagen-builder like retinal.
Wear sunglasses if you spend a lot of time outdoors. It protects the skin around your eyes and also helps you avoid squinting.
Dry flaky lips appear thin and give you an aged look. Apply lip balm generously for full and young looking lips.
Use a lip balm containing shea butter to help your lips heal faster.
If you have brittle nails, rub a waxy lip balm on them to make them soft.
Quick nail care at home: remove nail polish, clean nails with lemon juice and massage cuticles with lip balm.
Exposing your hands to soap and water for long periods can make nails split and break. Applying thick moisturizer may help.
Avoid using harsh cleansers even if you have oily skin. Something that makes your skin feel tight and dry is not right for it.
Cleanse your face before going to bed even if you have been indoors and applied no makeup to get rid of bacteria,dead cells and oil.
Keep your skincare regime simple. Avoid using too many products as the ingredients could react and irritate your skin.
Frequent and vigorous cleansing can irritate your skin and make acne worse. Wash acne-prone skin twice daily with a mild soap and warm water.
Do not wash your face more than twice a day as excessive cleansing strips off the protective layer that keeps skin soft and healthy.
A mix of sandalwood and almond paste is a very effective remedy for removing sun tan and is also soothing for the skin.
For super soft skin massage your body with oil before getting into the shower. Then exfoliate with a mild scrub.
A glass of carrot juice is loaded with vitamins that are great for your skin and has fewer calories than fruit juices.
If you have sensitive skin, prefer a fragrance free moisturizer as additives used for fragrance can irritate your skin.
Scrubbing is good for acne prone skin but only when done very gently. Harsh scrubbing can worsen acne by aggravating inflammation.
Never exert pressure on the face while massaging it. Facial massage should always be done with a light, feathery touch of fingers.
Applying a pack made of tomato pulp and lemon juice can reduce acne as it has antibacterial properties.
To lighten black spots left by acne apply sandalwood paste mixed with rose water. Leave on for 30 minutes and wash.
Adequate sleep is a must for youthful skin. Skin repairing hormones are released while you sleep.
Your skin needs special care after mid-twenties as skin renewal slows down. Good diet and moisturizing well are most important.
It`s a good idea to use a separate small towel for your face and wash it more often to keep skin free of pimples.
Reduce the redness around a recently burst pimple by applying ice for five to ten minutes.
Stress is a major reason for dull looking skin.Yoga or meditation can be your key to looking your best everyday.
Gram flour mixed with milk, lemon juice and turmeric powder is an excellent cleanser to remove makeup and dirt.
Blackheads and whiteheads are caused by clogged pores. Applying a retinol containing cream can help clear them off.
Avoid using antibacterial soap on your face on a daily basis as most of them are too harsh for your skin.
Apply a paste of coconut milk and sandalwood powder on your face. It removes dead skin and makes your skin soft and glowing.
Oily skin also needs moisturizer. But you need to use products that are water based and non comedogenic.
If you have sensitive skin avoid using fruit based face scrubs. Go for scrubs with synthetic beads which are more uniform and gentle.
If you have normal to dry skin, you can use extra virgin olive oil as a moisturizer at night to make your skin super soft.
Keep hair away from your face if you are prone to acne. Constant contact with hair irritates skin and can cause breakouts.
Avoid squeezing pimples as it pushes infected material deeper into your skin leading to more zits.
Rosewater works as an excellent gentle toner for sensitive skin.
To lighten sun tan mix equal amounts of potato juice and lemon juice, apply on affected area for fifteen minutes and wash off.
Winter sun is milder but can still damage your skin. Apply ample sunscreen before you enjoy the sunshine.
Coconut oil is an excellent body moisturizer. It has good amounts of Vitamin E which is excellent for the skin.
Baby shampoo can be used for removing heavy makeup. It will do all the cleansing and won`t irritate your skin and eyes.
To reduce skin oiliness, apply a mixture of one tsp of honey with one tsp of lemon juice and egg white. Wash off after 20 minutes.
For a glowing complexion, apply a face pack of saffron, sandalwood paste and turmeric mixed in yogurt or milk.
To make a natural age-defying face pack: mix 1 egg yolk, 1 tablespoon of honey, 1 tablespoon of plain yogurt,and half teaspoon of olive oil.
Age shows not only on face but also on the skin of your hands and feet. Moisturize them regularly to keep them wrinkle free.
The skin on your neck and hands tells your age. Anti-ageing treatments should also focus on these areas for a truly younger appearance.
Use a strong scrub such as one with apricot kernels for exfoliating hands, feet and back to get rid of dead skin cells.
Rub an ice cube over your face before applying foundation. This closes your pores and prevents them from getting clogged with makeup.
Silicone containing foundations are great for mature skin as they glide smoothly without settling in fine lines and wrinkles.
Avoid applying lipstick on dry chapped lips. Moisturize and gently remove flakes to make your lipstick look better.
To make thin lips appear full dab some lip gloss in the center of your lower lip after applying lipstick.
Blend a light colored highlighter with your eye shadow to create the impression of large beautiful eyes.
A quick dab of compressed powder can make an oily and tired face look fresh in seconds.
Do not try to match your lip and nail colors with your dress. Go for colors that complement your skin tone and do not clash with the dress.
To prevent mascara from flaking or smudging, run an eyelash brush through lashes to remove clumpy mascara build-up.
Use a good moisturiser for a clean, fresh look and some tinted blush on cheeks to add instant colour to the face.
Replace your eye liner and mascara every three months to minimize the chances of eye infection.
Never apply foundation lighter than your actual skin color as it will make your makeup look very unnatural.
If you do not have time for facial before party then apply an egg white mask and rub an ice cube on your face before putting makeup.
Wash your makeup brushes with some shampoo to keep them bacteria free and hence healthy for your skin.
For a glamorous look, choose a bright colored nail polish that compliments your skin tone.
For a radiant but natural look, apply body shimmer after you have applied moisturizer. This also makes the shimmer set better.
Very dark lipstick color can make your lips thin and aged. For plump lips use a lip-liner and fill with a slightly lighter shade.
Thick foundation can make wrinkles very prominent. Light foundation dabbed with a sponge gives a smoother look.
When applying anti-aging creams pay maximum attention to areas around the mouth, eyes and neck as they are most prone to wrinkles.
Clever makeup should highlight your best feature. Use bold lipstick on shapely lips or eyeliner to emphasize beautiful eyes.
If you have applied a bright colored lipstick, use neutral colors on your cheek and eyes for a sophisticated look.
Applying nail polish in a hurry? Use a shimmer polish as imperfections in its application will be much less visible.
For an extra glamorous evening look apply a shimmer lotion to apt places on your body such as the collar bones.
Use products that match your skin type—hydrating formulas for dry skin, water-based for oily skin and hypoallergenic for sensitive skin.
If your skin is prone to acne, go for powder based cosmetics instead of cream based ones.
For an evening party in dim lights, put some gold dust over your lipstick to give your lips an attractive look.
Apply makeup with clean fingertips only as far as possible. Brushes and applicators frequently contain germs that can irritate skin.
Gentle exfoliation and deep moisturizing before applying makeup is great because it gives a more fresh and clean look.
Always apply makeup with good quality brushes for a clean and professional look.
Use makeup to highlight your best features and not to hide imperfections. Downplay the less perfect ones with subtle makeup.
Protect your cosmetics from excess light and heat as high temperature will destroy the preservatives that keep the product bacteria free.
